issue.title: Standalone executable crashes when gazebo is not yet started

content.raw:
Doing so results in a new problem:


```
Error [Node.cc:76] No namespace found
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::bad_alloc'
  what():  std::bad_alloc
Aborted (core dumped)
```

Although it no longer dies, it has the wrong namespace and so the behavior of the program changes. Is there a way to allow the stand alone program to wait for a namespace to become available?

Here's a minimal 'application.':
 
https://bitbucket.org/dawonn/gazebo/src/f3ccd7cfa003/examples/stand_alone/publisher?at=default
